COMMENT_TX: Boone lost it in the sun
Through Wamby and rolled out to Welch
Gross was hit by his own batted ball
Poole's ball struck Ump Connolly and bounded into RF
Combs stopped at 2B because of his charley horse
Prothro caught the carom off 3B bag
Flagstead ducked to avoid the pitch but it hit his bat
Gehrig waved off Combs but it wafted over him and landed on the LF terrace near the fence.  Runners had to hold up.
Swinging bunt; O'Neill muffed Pennock's throw
Cold A slight drizzle began to fall 30 minutes before game time. Tarpaulins were put on the field as it fell in earnest, and the start was delayed 15 minutes. NYT=10000, NYEW/NYTEM=3000
Ward juggled it but recovered in time
Ran up the LF terrace and robbed him of a hit
Wingfield tripped in fielding it and threw him out as he lay supine on his side.
Combs fell on the terrace as he made the catch
NYEW coverage ended here The following events derived from NY Times game summary/box
BOUNCE HR over Miller; it hurdled the bend of the low, wooden fence in front of RF bleachers on first bounce.
Caromed off Ruffing's shin to Todt
Beautiful play; Lamar did not slide
Walberg blocked hot liner straight at his head
Great 1-handed stop; he back-handed it to Dykes whose relay was late.
Screeching double to the mound in LCF; break-neck slide by Connolly at home beat Galloway's throw.
A's kicked on Ump Dinneen's called ball four
BG=107 PDL: '1001 fans defied threatening clouds'
Hit Lucey's shin and bounced high in the air
Nice slide away from Connolly at 2B by Poole
Into the bleachers of deepest RCF where Hank Gowdy hit a few in the 1914 World Series.
Runners going on 3-2 count; long windup by Wingfield
Great 1-handed leaping catch on the terrace
Miller injured his finger trying to make the catch
Hit & run; Perkins thought it was strike 3 and heaved to 2B which was uncovered.
Easy DP ball but no one covered 2B
Good running catch; nearly caught Connolly off 2B
Surprise bunt; frantic throw sailed over Todt
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
McNulty lost it in the sun
Spurgeon fumbled; hurried throw was scooped nicely by Knode
CPD: all infielders handled the ball but no more details
Hit over Speaker; Spurgeon's relay bounded over L.Sewell
Leaping catch as it was clearing the fence
Wicked bounder hit Lutzke on the chin and was badly cut
Great running catch near LCF mound
Lutzke failed to SH twice before singling
Perfect throw home took an unusually high bound allowing Myatt to score.
When Rice juggled momentarily Carlyle tried for 3B
Tried for 2B on short passed ball
Bounced off Lee's glove to Wamby
Into RF bleachers, just over the jumping Hooper's glove
Double steal and WP on same play
Tough hop; Davis juggled it, then made a hurried throw to 1B
Boone was bothered by the sun; the ball hit the tip of one of his fingers and dropped safe, while Ike staggered around holding on to the injured hand.
Lee lost easy pop in sun; Davis held 2B
Boston Globe: S3/G, Sheely being obliged to make a 1-handed play on the grounder.
Source 127 difficult to read in many places BG=125
Wide throw; Sheely tried to pick it out of the runner's ribs with 1 hand but couldn't hold on.
Perfect bunt after fouling off two SH attempts Source 127: 53/SH...
Hit way out on the terrace by the fence in LCF.
Bad hop over Flagstead turned a single into a triple
Wamby just managed to knock it down on RF grass
Hit high up against LF fence
Over the highest section of the LF fence
To the terrace; Veach couldn't hold it
Caromed off Wamby's leg into deep RF
Carlyle sneaked to 3B as Schang argued close call at plate
Nice running 1-handed catch near the pavilion
Nifty headlong 1-handed catch after a long sprint
During this AB Ruth bunted foul trying for a hit

Fastball hit him in the back and knocked him down.  He lay writhing as if in great pain; eventually walked to 1B. NYT: The pill hit him in the kidneys and Sam went flat, twisting so furiously that he seemed to be in a convulsion. Two players held his legs and two others his head while Trainer Woods shouted words of encouragement.
Bad throw past 1B rolled to the pavilion.
Nice catch with a burst of speed
ej,johne102,P,owenb901,Bench jockeying Ernie Johnson ejected by HP umpire Brick Owens from the bench
Over Vache who fell negotiating the banked terrace; Gehrig advanced on the relayed throw home.
Took it on the grass back of SS
Just over the front wall of RF bleachers
Running catch at the foul line
Ruth fell on the terrace making a desperate try for it as it sailed over him.
Caromed off Dugan's right knee and bounded 10 feet away in front of him.  He was knocked down but resumed play after Doc Woods worked on him.
NYTEM account continued on a page unavailable for review
Scratch hit on bounder past Rogell
Low liner which Boone could not hold; Gehrig ran to 3B but missed 2B.  It was officially called a fielder's choice.
$Leibold replaced Gregg after Gregg fouled off first pitch
Threw over Burns to the fence

Burns ran towards 2B before Ehmke started to pitch.  Ehmke backed off the rubber and, with one eye on McNulty, began closing in on Burns who stopped about 10' from 2B.  When Burns made a dive into 2B, Ehmke's throw hit him on the shoulder and caromed into RF.
Speaker fumbled as he was about to return it to the infield
BG=100 BG=2500 SLA: Ken Williams out with sore arm. Giard was presented with a diamond stickpin before game by his hometown fans from Ware, MA.
Sisler's first game back after infected leg problem
Sensational stop but wild throw hit Wamby on the foot and rolled toward dugout.  Wamby was badly hurt.
Clear over the high signboard in LF
Hooper caught it on his knees after a long run
Great 1-handed catch up the incline against the scoreboard
box scores and pbp account all had 2 SO by Ruffing.
Collins trapped the little infield fly and threw to Sheely. Lee was caught flat-footed a few feet off 1B but Picinich looked safe.
Prothro batted it down but couldn't recover in time
Off Williams' glove as he stumbled on the incline just as he was about to catch it.
Kamm let Hooper's perfect throw escape to the dugout
Threatening conditions from the start & throughout the game.
Big collision; Cochrane appeared hurt but waved off help
Through Todt with infield in; Rogell recovered in short RF
Freak hop past 3B; it started foul but changed direction and caromed off the bag.  Williams' return got past Prothro.
Stole as Harriss turned to throw to 1B
Off the top of LCF fence; 22-game hit streak
3B was uncovered; Ehmke made a hurried/wild throw past 1B
Great play; Hale was spiked as he dove at Prothro's feet
Flagstead knocked down Galloway as he whirled to throw to 1B.  The game was delayed as Galloway was hurt.
Galloway fumbled, still had a chance to get Ruffing, but bounced the throw to 1B.
Luebbe tipped Flagstead's bat on the 3rd strike; no error reported
During this AB Picinich hit what looked like a good double but was called foul.
Ward took it right under Paschal's nose
Over LCF fence, several feet further out than the old town clock.
High and far into RF bleachers First player to reach 300 HRs
Ruth took 3B on Wingfield's pickoff throw to 1B
Wamby handled the high throw well
